comment: This professor is HORRIBLE. He has specific favorites that he gives opportunities to and is not afraid to make that known. Grades very hard and doesn't truly care if the student passes or fails. As a person he's a nice guy, but as a professor very harsh. Rambles in lectures that have nothing to do with the subject that we need to learn.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Had us buy textbook, to then admit to the class a month into semester that he had never even opened the book. Made it confusing to get correct answers/clarification. Can't hear (will have to speak loud) and speaks at a slow pace. Kinda smug and isn't very engaging during lectures. 3 exams, no homework, and class participation matters. Don't take.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: If you're planning on taking his class, then prepare to know the materials yourself. He'll push you to read the text book but some of the questions will hardly come from it. Majority of your grades will come from the 3 tests. He will also go on a tangent about “emotional intelligence”. He also hardly knows the material from the said textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: He's a nice man so I hate to say he's a terrible teacher but... It was his first time back teaching in a while so he kept experimenting with different ways of teaching styles which ultimately made it confusing. Lectures turned into to rambles of nonsense. Didn't give out dates for group work. Heavily graded participation but never recorded it.

I think this may be the worst professor I've ever had. This man just likes to hear himself talk for an hour. No homework assignments and 3 exams for the whole semester. Doesn't make study guides or any announcements. Pointless/boring lectures and talks kinda slow. On "exam prep" days, he only talked about test taking strategies. Do not recommend.

comment: I took him Fall 2024 for History 2112, the most important thing is that you take the initiative to read a little bit from the textbook so you can participate and discuss it in class. I always enjoyed the discussions even when it got awkward. He's a real chill guy, and I think the bad reviews were mainly because this was his first year at KSU.

I'm honestly surprised there are so many bad reviews. Everyone says he's terrible but I enjoyed his class he is rlly just a chill guy. He was a harsh grader and I really struggled in this class at first but this class taught me how to study in college. There is a textbook but I never read it ngl. Also, he did give us makeup work if u ask.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Final grade will be based off of 3 exams, individual part., & group part. The only real resource is the textbook. No study guides & when he would post the PowerPoints they were not helpful. The tests are hard & includes essays worth 30 points. He is a nice man, but not the best professor. If you take this class, be prepared to READ and PARTICIPATE.

comment: Unless your a teachers pet I wouldn't recommend this teacher, mandatory participation for a grade but he doesn't record anything when you participate and basically puts in participation based on how much he likes you, no resources outside of class other than the textbook, a good bit of the class is useless blabbering, if you take this just lock in.

comment: Mr. Bertrand is an amazing professor, he seems new to teaching but he does really enjoy history. There is a textbook but it's free online and he gives you the link to it in his syllabus and there are YouTube videos on every chapter if you don't have time to read them. He does grade on participation but he makes it fun and interesting!

comment: Not a bad professor overall, but his lectures sometimes don't make sense. He will post powerpoints then delete them, or won't post them at all. Which in this case is difficult because the textbook is very wordy and this lack of homework makes it even harder to follow

comment: Doesn't give study guides, the only grades are group participation, individual participation, and 3 exams. Everything in the exams is from the book and the book isn't horribly bad to read. Lectures are him pacing around and rambling so if you have trouble with that don't take his class. He has PowerPoints but they aren't helpful unless you've read.

comment: Professor Bertrand provided a fun class environment where discussions/participation were heavily encouraged. As long as you stick to the textbook (which wasn't too bad) and participate in class, you should be fine. The class itself was quite fun, and Professor Bertrand is very communicative and engaging within his classroom.
